Util::Object

Util::Object Class Reference
[Multithreading]

Object with synchronisation mutex and condition variablesThe Object class defines object that needs to have and identifier, reference counter and synchronisation primitives. Only the identifier and reference counter are part of the state of the object. The synchronisation objects (one mutex and one condition) should not considered as in the state of the object. Thus all methods involving only synchronisation objects may be declared as 'const' with respect to the object. More...

Detailed Description

Object with synchronisation mutex and condition variables

The Object class defines object that needs to have and identifier, reference counter and synchronisation primitives. Only the identifier and reference counter are part of the state of the object. The synchronisation objects (one mutex and one condition) should not considered as in the state of the object. Thus all methods involving only synchronisation objects may be declared as 'const' with respect to the object.
